name: Google I/O Extended Buea 2017
description: It's That Time Of The Year Again When We Get Acquainted With Google's Latest Technologies And How We Can Apply Them To Our Startups, Academics And Communities For Faster Scale. There'll Be Code Labs On Google Cloud Platform, App Engine, Tensorflow, Kubernetes, AngularJS, Firebase And Google Analytics.

name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended Buea
description:
Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.

GDD Extended Buea Will Be An Event Where We LiveStream The Event and follow through with Codelabs on Tensorflow and GCP.

name: DevFest Fako 2017
description: The DevFest Fako 2017 event is a three-days-long hack-streak aimed at getting students, developers and entrepreneurs from GDGs in Fako (GDG Buea and GDG Limbe ) to learn Google's technologies such as Firebase, Cloud And Tensorflow and use them to build a PWA utilising Firebase Cloud and Offline-first functions. We intend to develop this PWA during a two-day Firebase AppFest at Skylabase Inc on Thursday November 9th And Friday November 10th 2017. The very next day, we'll showcase the PWA, Launch a Tensorflow Masterclass, promote gender diversity as well as enjoy a Fireside Chat on Cloud Computing at Eta Palace Hotel .

name: IWD Buea 2018
description:
It's an honor to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

International Women's Day (IWD) 2018 Buea is a hands-on driven event that aims at providing developers and tech enthusiasts (females especially) with fundamental skills in Android application development, Docker, Arduino and Graphic design while addressing the under-representation of women in STEM ( Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics).

This event will be characterized by a panel session, codelabs, inspiring videos, and lightning talks. Summarily, there will be four parallel codelab sessions, and each participant will have to register for just one session. Requirements:
Pen, Book, and Laptop

Event Agenda: https://goo.gl/b7k6Y9

name: Git/Github Workshop
description:
The Git/Github workshop class is geared towards teaching participants how to use version control systems (case study-Git and Github). It will be a hands-on practical session.

Requirements.
1. A laptop
2. An internet box
3. A notebook and pen

name: Google I/O Extended Buea 2018
description: The Google I/O Extended Buea 2018 event is a three-days-long event ( View Party, Hackday and Creative Day ) aimed at getting tech enthusiasts, students, developers and entrepreneurs from GDG Buea to learn and gain hand-on experience using Google's technologies such as Google Cloud Platform, Flutter, Firebase And Tensorflow as well as understand the critical place of UX/UI design in software development. During the View Party, we'll watch the Google I/O 2018 videos to learn what’s new in Android, Cloud, Tensorflow, Firebase and PWA. The Hackday will be a day where developers experience hands-on Codelab sessions on the aforementioned technologies while the Creative Day will be a day for the audience to learn the critical place of UI/UX design in software design at Eta Palace Hotel.

name: Opensource/Categorization of Wikimedia Commons
description:
Agenda
* An opening prayer
* Welcome address
*An overview of Opensource by Courage Angeh
* Getting started with Opensource- case study Wikimedia by Mondjo Perside
*Categorization of comic pictures on Wikimedia
* Closing Remarks
*Conclusion

Requirements
1. A laptop
2. Internet box
3. Positive attitude

name: Coding Boot Camp
description:
This event is a three-day boot camp aimed at enabling ladies to build mini-projects, while learning, and or improving their coding skills in a particular technology.

Reserve your swag by registering here: https://goo.gl/CFnTyZ

Agenda: https://goo.gl/bqamWM

Featured Technologies:
* Java
* Android
* Python
* PHP
* HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Docker
* Graphic Design

Requirements:
* A laptop (compulsory)
* A fueled internet box (highly recommended)
* An IDE(Integrated Development Environment) for the language you pick.
* Positive attitude
how_to_find_us: University of Buea - American Corner Space

name: DevFest + Cloud Next Extended Buea 2018
description: The DevFest Buea 2018 event is a two-days-long event ( 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM Each Day ) taking place at ActivSpaces Buea aimed at getting developers and entrepreneurs from the Buea tech community to learn about Google's technologies such as Firebase, GCP, Cloud Functions And Tensorflow as well as share their experiences contributing to open source. Our event's first day is fully dedicated to #Opensource where we promote gender diversity and members share their experiences contributing to the Open Source Community while the next day is fully dedicated to #Cloud wherein we'll do codelabs on Google's technologies.
how_to_find_us: Top Floor Of First Trust Building, Soppo (Opposite OIC Buea)

name: Google Summer of Code (GSoC) 2019 Mentorship

venue.name: ActivSpaces, 1st Trust Building Top Left Floor, Great Soppo

description:
Help us change the world one line of code at a time!

Over the last 14 years, GSoC has enabled more than 14,762 students from 109 countries to work with 651 open source projects and produce millions of lines of code since its inception in 2005.

The goals of the program are to:
● Motivate students to begin participating in open source
development.
● Provide students in Computer Science and related fields the
opportunity to do work related to their academic pursuits.
● Give students exposure to real-world software development
scenarios (e.g., testing, version control, software licensing,
mailing-list etiquette, etc.).
● Create more open source code.
● Help open source projects bring in new developers.

* Event Agenda: https://goo.gl/reqCuu

* Things to bring:
- A laptop
- A wifi box
- Positive attitude.

* Useful resources:
- GSOC timeline: https://goo.gl/aMEMFm
- Program overview: https://goo.gl/bY9UGf
- Student guide: https://goo.gl/re9xTv

name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: ActivSpaces, 1st Trust Building Top Left Floor, Great Soppo

description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

SOME TOPICS THAT WILL BE COVERED:
1. Firebase web: Learn how to use Firebase for web application deployment by developing a chat client web application that utilizes Firebase's core features.

2. Running WordPress on App Engine Flexible Environment

3. Extract, Analyze, and Translate Text from Images with the Cloud ML APIs

NB: Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.
how_to_find_us: For any further inquiries, please contact +237 679574561 or info@gdgbuea.net
